content:
Diagnosis:		Left breast small cell carcinoma

Stage:		pT1cN0M0

Biomarkers:	Triple negative breast cancer, TILs 90%

Treatment:		12 Jan 2024 Wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy
			1 Feb - 15 Mar 2024 Adjuvant chemotherapy with 4 cycles of dose-dense AC
			20 Mar - 30 Apr 2024 Adjuvant radiotherapy completed

Current Situation:	End of treatment review

[redacted name] has completed her planned course of adjuvant treatment for early stage breast cancer. She tolerated chemotherapy well with only grade 1 fatigue and minimal nausea. Radiotherapy was completed with expected grade 1 skin reaction which is now resolving. Her energy levels are improving and she has maintained good mobility throughout treatment with regular walking.

On examination today, the left breast shows expected post-radiotherapy changes with mild skin pigmentation. The surgical scar is well-healed. No concerning features are identified in either breast or axillae.

I have explained that she has completed her planned adjuvant treatment. We will arrange mammogram in 6 months and see her in clinic afterwards. She understands to contact us sooner if any new concerns develop.

cancer_timeline.value: Wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy
Started adjuvant chemotherapy with dose-dense AC

patient_facts.value: Left breast shows post-radiotherapy changes with mild skin pigmentation, well-healed surgical scar
Maintained good mobility throughout treatment with regular walking

status_updates.value: Early stage triple negative breast cancer. Successfully completed planned course of multimodality adjuvant treatment with good tolerance
Grade 1 fatigue and minimal nausea during chemotherapy, grade 1 skin reaction to radiotherapy
Completed all planned adjuvant treatment including surgery, chemotherapy and radiotherapy
